intro: Randia pueblensis, commonly known as the Puebla randia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, spherical berries that are typically red when mature. Randia pueblensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
